title: Google\Cloud\Functions\V1\CloudFunction
name: CloudFunction
description:
Describes a Cloud Function that contains user computation executed in response to an event. It encapsulate function and triggers configurations.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.functions.v1.CloudFunction

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.name
params.description: A user-defined name of the function. Function names must be unique globally and match pattern projects/*/locations/*/functions/*

params.name: data.description
params.description: User-provided description of a function.

params.name: data.source_archive_url
params.description: The Google Cloud Storage URL, starting with gs://, pointing to the zip archive which contains the function.

params.name: data.source_repository
params.description: Beta Feature The source repository where a function is hosted.

params.name: data.source_upload_url
params.description: The Google Cloud Storage signed URL used for source uploading, generated by calling [google.cloud.functions.v1.GenerateUploadUrl]. The signature is validated on write methods (Create, Update) The signature is stripped from the Function object on read methods (Get, List)

params.name: data.https_trigger
params.description: An HTTPS endpoint type of source that can be triggered via URL.

params.name: data.event_trigger
params.description: A source that fires events in response to a condition in another service.

params.name: data.status
params.description: Output only. Status of the function deployment.

params.name: data.entry_point
params.description: The name of the function (as defined in source code) that will be executed. Defaults to the resource name suffix, if not specified. For backward compatibility, if function with given name is not found, then the system will try to use function named "function". For Node.js this is name of a function exported by the module specified in source_location.

params.name: data.runtime
params.description: The runtime in which to run the function. Required when deploying a new function, optional when updating an existing function. For a complete list of possible choices, see the gcloud command reference.

params.name: data.timeout
params.description: The function execution timeout. Execution is considered failed and can be terminated if the function is not completed at the end of the timeout period. Defaults to 60 seconds.

params.name: data.available_memory_mb
params.description: The amount of memory in MB available for a function. Defaults to 256MB.

params.name: data.service_account_email
params.description: The email of the function's service account. If empty, defaults to {project_id}@appspot.gserviceaccount.com.

params.name: data.update_time
params.description: Output only. The last update timestamp of a Cloud Function.

params.name: data.version_id
params.description: Output only. The version identifier of the Cloud Function. Each deployment attempt results in a new version of a function being created.

params.name: data.labels
params.description: Labels associated with this Cloud Function.

params.name: data.environment_variables
params.description: Environment variables that shall be available during function execution.

params.name: data.network
params.description: The VPC Network that this cloud function can connect to. It can be either the fully-qualified URI, or the short name of the network resource. If the short network name is used, the network must belong to the same project. Otherwise, it must belong to a project within the same organization. The format of this field is either projects/{project}/global/networks/{network} or {network}, where {project} is a project id where the network is defined, and {network} is the short name of the network. This field is mutually exclusive with vpc_connector and will be replaced by it. See the VPC documentation for more information on connecting Cloud projects.

params.name: data.max_instances
params.description: The limit on the maximum number of function instances that may coexist at a given time.

params.name: data.vpc_connector
params.description: The VPC Network Connector that this cloud function can connect to. It can be either the fully-qualified URI, or the short name of the network connector resource. The format of this field is projects/*/locations/*/connectors/* This field is mutually exclusive with network field and will eventually replace it. See the VPC documentation for more information on connecting Cloud projects.

params.name: data.vpc_connector_egress_settings
params.description: The egress settings for the connector, controlling what traffic is diverted through it.

params.name: data.ingress_settings
params.description: The ingress settings for the function, controlling what traffic can reach it.

params.name: data.build_id
params.description: Output only. The Cloud Build ID of the latest successful deployment of the function.

methods.name: getEntryPoint
methods.description:
The name of the function (as defined in source code) that will be executed. Defaults to the resource name suffix, if not specified. For backward compatibility, if function with given name is not found, then the system will try to use function named "function".

For Node.js this is name of a function exported by the module specified in source_location.

methods.name: getNetwork
methods.description:
The VPC Network that this cloud function can connect to. It can be either the fully-qualified URI, or the short name of the network resource.

If the short network name is used, the network must belong to the same project. Otherwise, it must belong to a project within the same organization. The format of this field is either projects/{project}/global/networks/{network} or {network}, where {project} is a project id where the network is defined, and {network} is the short name of the network. This field is mutually exclusive with vpc_connector and will be replaced by it. See the VPC documentation for more information on connecting Cloud projects.

Generated from protobuf field string network = 18;
